This week I reintroduced the #FreshStartAct, which provides for the expungement of certain nonviolent offenses. Allowing those who made mistakes earlier in their lives, and already served their sentences, to wipe the slate clean is essential to creating a more just system.

In America, even a nonviolent offense can be a life sentence. That's because the stigma of a conviction will follow you for the rest of your life. Employment, education, and housing‚Äìthe very things necessary for a fresh start‚Äìcan all be denied on the basis of a past conviction.
